channel.title: mixed-effects modeling on Violet Brown
channel.description: Recent content in mixed-effects modeling on Violet Brown

item.title: Introduction to Mixed Modeling Video: Part 2
item.description: This is part 2 of a 2 of a series of videos on mixed effects modeling. The intended audience is graduate student or anyone with some regression background but no background in mixed modeling.

item.title: Introduction to Mixed Modeling Video: Part 1
item.description: This is part 1 of a 2 of a series of videos on mixed effects modeling. The intended audience is graduate student or anyone with some regression background but no background in mixed modeling.

item.title: An Introduction to Linear Mixed-Effects Modeling in R
item.description: This Tutorial serves as both an approachable theoretical introduction to mixed-effects modeling and a practical introduction to how to implement mixed-effects models in R. The intended audience is researchers who have some basic statistical knowledge, but little or no experience implementing mixed-effects models in R using their own data. In an attempt to increase the accessibility of this Tutorial, I deliberately avoid using mathematical terminology beyond what a student would learn in a standard graduate-level statistics course, but I reference articles and textbooks that provide more detail for interested readers.

In an attempt to increase the accessibility of this Tutorial, I deliberately avoid using mathematical terminology beyond what a student would learn in a standard graduate-level statistics course, but I reference articles and textbooks that provide more detail for interested readers.
